image.altText: A swarm of red fire ants.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth and state governments are doubling down on a half-billion-dollar program that's so far failed to stop the spread of the red imported fire ant.

title.children: The billion dollar battle to wipe out a deadly pest that is threatening Australia's outdoor lifestyle

image.altText: An edited portrait of Scott Morrison against a dark background.

props.synopsis: The Nemesis finale had Coalition colleagues and state premiers weighing in on Scott Morrison's prime ministership. We unpacked the third and final episode, with political analysis from Leigh Sales.

title.children: We unpacked Scott Morrison's prime ministership in the Nemesis finale â€” with political analysis from Leigh Sales

image.altText: Linda Reynolds stands at a lectern with a microphone against a blue background.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal cabinet minister Linda Reynolds has announced she will stand down from politics at the next federal election.

title.children: Former Morrison cabinet minister Linda Reynolds to leave politics at next election

image.altText: The back of a firefighter.

props.synopsis: Victorian fire authorities urge several communities in the state's north-west to consider evacuating tonight, ahead of "catastrophic" fire conditions forecast for Tuesday.

title.children: Parts of Victoria urged to prepare for evacuation ahead of 'catastrophic' fire danger

image.altText: Fire fighting aircraft seen from below against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: They may spend most of their time spraying crops, but "rugged" planes have transformed from farming equipment into firefighting machines to help extinguish a blaze threatening a tiny coastal community in Tasmania.

title.children: A Tasmanian community narrowly escaped a fire catastrophe in November, so this time they 'hit it with everything we've got'

image.altText: Sonia Gardner bows her head.

props.synopsis: Sonia and Kevin shared the heartbreak of being left with an incomplete home full of defects. Their story was one of the reasons the Tasmanian government drew up new laws â€” but seven months after those laws passed parliament, they are yet to be implemented.

title.children: Seven months after passing Tasmania's parliament, laws giving protection to home owners are still not in force

image.altText: Two women at the beach stand in front of a free standing diving board out at sea.

props.synopsis: Residents of Beauty Point in northern Tasmania rally to save their diving board, thought to be up to 90 years old, amid safety concerns about the ageing structure.

title.children: Affectionately known as 'the divo', could this historical diving board become a thing of the past?

image.altText: A montage of pictures of an American football game

props.synopsis: Super Bowl LVIII had just about everything â€” a sideline stoush between Travis Kelce and Andy Reid, a trick-play touchdown and a crucial blocked extra point. Here are the five quick hits from Las Vegas.

title.children: Super Bowl five quick hits: Kelce shoves his coach and a 49er suffers a shocking sideline injury in overtime thriller

image.altText: Patrick Mahomes puts his hands on his head after winning SUper Bowl LVIII.

props.synopsis: When Patrick Mahomes came into the league, everyone knew he could make spectacular plays. Now that he can put on the sort of complete performance we saw in Super Bowl LVIII, there's a legitimate case that he's the best we've ever seen.

title.children: Is this the greatest NFL player of all time?

image.altText: A split image of a woman in a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: Missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy has three children with strong connections in the community and her disappearance has left some children feeling anxious.

title.children: School children left 'nervous' by disappearance of Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy

image.altText: Cracks in the wall and roof of a house.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian couple has been fighting for compensation from the state-owned water company after it took almost a month to fix a water main outside their home â€” with a TasWater employee even describing the company's response to the leak as "disgraceful".

title.children: 'This was our dream': Couple say home irreparable after it took 24 days to fix a burst water main

image.altText: A swarm of red fire ants.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth and state governments are doubling down on a half-billion-dollar program that's so far failed to stop the spread of the red imported fire ant.

title.children: The billion dollar battle to wipe out a deadly pest that is threatening Australia's outdoor lifestyle

image.altText: Josh Frydenberg and Scott Morrison stand at podia with an Australian flag behind them

props.synopsis: Josh Frydenberg tells the ABC political docuseries Nemesis that Scott Morrison having himself sworn into the Treasury portfolio did lasting damage to their relationship. For his part, the former PM says he apologised to his former treasurer and the pair remain friends.

title.children: Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg were friends, colleagues and housemates. But there was something the PM had not told his treasurer

image.altText: worker smooths concrete at a slab pour with other workers in background.

props.synopsis: Workers shoulder the burden of paying for the things we want: schools, hospitals and a civil, safe society. But as our population ages and more people need support, can income tax continue to fund our needs?Â

title.children: 'It's not just unfair but immoral': Why experts say Australia's tax system is broken and what can be done to fix it

image.altText: Police officers standing next to cars, with tropical plants visible behind

props.synopsis: Police shot a 39-year-old man dead in the rural township of Ilbilbie, south of Mackay, after he allegedly pulled out a firearm while trying to flee from officers.

title.children: Police union alleges gun pulled on officers moments before fatal shooting

image.altText: Fernando Simon Marman hugs a woman around the same age with short hair tightly in a hospital hallway

props.synopsis: Israel launched a special forces operation that has freed two Israeli hostages in Rafah amid air strikes, which local health officials said killed 67 people and wounded dozens in the southern Gaza city.

title.children: Israel rescues two hostages in Rafah, as health officials say 67 people killed by air strikes

image.altText: A grey-haired man in a light blue Snoopy tshirt that reads Be Happy

props.synopsis: Some of the more unsavoury practices of the country's multi-billion-dollar general insurance sector were on full display last week, including delays, denials, predatory low-ball cash settlement offers and gaslighting, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: The clock is ticking on an industry that plays hardball with customers at their weakest moments

image.altText: Grainy footage shows a man in a suit lying on the ground, one hand to his ear holding a phone.

props.synopsis: Barnaby Joyce says he "made a big mistake", blaming medication for his behaviour, after being filmed swearing into his phone while lying on his back on a Canberra street late last Wednesday.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce says late-night lie down 'a big mistake'

image.altText: A middle aged man in a light blue shirt and dark blazer clasps his hands mid-speech.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he's "actively considering" asking the Governor for an early election, after a meeting on Friday with two Liberal-turned-independent MPs didn't result in what he required.

title.children: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff has given his strongest indication yet that there'll be an early election

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: Nearly 40 people released from immigration detention following a High Court decision last year have been told they do not have to wear an electronic monitoring bracelet despite the government talking tough on protecting the community.

title.children: Half of 149 released immigration detainees convicted of violent offending, kidnapping or robbery

image.altText: A young boy looking at a sheet of paper with words on it

props.synopsis: One-third of Australian students are failing to learn to read proficiently, at an estimated cost to the economy of $40 billion, according to a new study.Â

title.children: Popular teaching style 'contrary to science' costing Australia $40 billion, report finds

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: A NSW police operation has led to the arrest of 590 high risk domestic violence offenders, and involved officers from every area command and district in the state.

title.children: Close to 600 domestic violence offenders arrested in 'successful' NSW police operation

image.altText: Secretary of the Department of Defence Dennis Richardson speaks at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A review has found the former Coalition government awarded contracts for offshore asylum seeker processing to companies with suspected links to arms and drug smuggling, corruption and bribery.

title.children: Home Affairs contracts awarded to companies with suspected links to drugs, firearms and bribery

image.altText: Taylor and Travis

props.synopsis: The Kansas City Chiefs go back-to-back after scoring a touchdown in the dying seconds of overtime to break 49ers hearts. Look back on all the action.Â

title.children: Chiefs claim stunning Super Bowl win over 49ers in overtime to go back-to-back

image.altText: Usher pointing wearing white and a white diamond encrusted glove, side profile

props.synopsis: The term 'Taylor Swift's boyfriend' is trending on X as the pop star attends the Super Bowl flanked by rapper Ice Spice and actor Blake Lively. Usher's guests include Alicia Keys, Lil Jon, Ludacris and H.ER. while BeyoncÃ© ad sets tongues wagging.

title.children: Usher's half-time show, Taylor Swift's boyfriend and BeyoncÃ© has people talking at the Super Bowl

image.altText: An aerial view of the red dirt and trees of the Juukan Gorge.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's newly amended cultural heritage laws are being put to the test for the first time, six months after the state government was forced to backflip on its decision to introduce controversial sweeping legislative changes.Â

title.children: Local shire and contractor charged under first test case of amended Juukan Gorge laws

image.altText: Children line up against a barrier with empty bowls

props.synopsis: The horrors of Gaza are almost unspeakable. As difficult as all this is to read and to watch, it's important the world does not look away, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The horrors facing Gaza's surviving children are unspeakable. How can this go on?

image.altText: A mosquito sits on an arm.

props.synopsis: Widespread wet weather around the state has created ideal breeding conditions for mosquitoes, with a high number tested from traps found to be carrying Ross River Virus.

title.children: Health authorities brace for Ross River Virus surge that may affect 'thousands' of Queenslanders

image.altText: A single firefighter fights a huge fire as it destroys wooden and plastic shelters

props.synopsis: In the Rohingya refugee camps of Cox's Bazar, more than 1 million people are living in worsening conditions. However, the world wasn't watching when tragedy unfolded.

title.children: A massive fire left 7,000 people, including thousands of children, homeless. Australia didn't seem to notice

image.altText: A wide shot of orange building with sign reading Carnarvon Courthouse

props.synopsis: Carnarvon Magistrates Court rules Exmouth childcare worker Amber Jade Brennan will be permitted to live under home detention in Perth ahead of her next court appearance.

title.children: Childcare worker accused of child stealing released on home detention

image.altText: A police car in front of a smashed Mercedes.

props.synopsis: Police urge residents to lock their homes after several luxury cars were allegedly stolen on the NSW Central Coast ahead of a pursuit that ended in Sydney's west Monday morning.Â

title.children: NSW teens charged over alleged luxury car pursuit were on bail for similar offences

image.altText: Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll

props.synopsis: Police Commissioner Karina Carroll asks for more powers for police to search people for weapons, particularly at shopping centres, after a grandmother's fatal stabbing.Â

title.children: Queensland police ask for more search powers, government to bring forward ban on selling knives to minors

image.altText: A man with short hair and an arm tattoo smiles at a camera

props.synopsis: Victorian water skier Luke Wentworth died from injuries suffered after he fell during the Southern 80 ski race on Sunday. Some are now calling for the race to be cancelled.

title.children: Death of a seventh competitor prompts debate over safety of Southern 80 Murray River race

image.altText: Composite image of Deborah Sebastian, Ronald Roe and Veronica Johnson for Youpla story.

props.synopsis: The federal government's immediate financial package will result in some customers in the Kimberley being reimbursed, but others will miss out.

title.children: Victims of collapsed funeral insurer reflect on 'bittersweet' resolution after repayment offer is announced

image.altText: Kelvin Kiptum looks on

props.synopsis: Kenyan world marathon record holder Kelvin Kiptum has died in an accident aged 24.

title.children: World Marathon record holder, Kenya's Kelvin Kiptum, dead aged 24
